intro: Crataegus incaedua, commonly known as the Inca hawthorn, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rosaceae. It is native to South America, particularly found in regions of Argentina and Chile. The plant is a small to medium-sized shrub or tree, typically reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have serrated margins, while its flowers are white or pink and appear in clusters. The fruit is a red, fleshy berry that contains several small seeds.
